sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Many UX professionals often find themselves working alone, and usually face more projects impacting user experience than they can handle. In this article, Paul Boag explains how UX teams can be transformed into a significant driver of customer-centric innovation within organizations.
articles.title: Rethinking The Role Of Your UX Teams And Move Beyond Firefighting

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Joas Pambou built an app that integrates vision language models (VLMs) and text-to-speech (TTS) AI technologies to describe images audibly with speech. This audio description tool can be a big help for people with sight challenges to understand what’s in an image. But how this does it even work? Joas explains how these AI systems work and their potential uses, including how he built the app and ways to further improve it.
articles.title: Integrating Image-To-Text And Text-To-Speech Models (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: WCAG provides guidance for making interactive elements more accessible by specifying minimum size requirements. In this article, Eric Bailey discusses the nuances of interactive element sizes and clarifies what it looks like to provide accessible interactive experiences using WCAG-compliant target sizes.
articles.title: Getting To The Bottom Of Minimum WCAG-Conformant Interactive Element Size

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mikołaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: In today’s turbulent landscape of design, Penpot stands out with its commitment to open-source, free unlimited access, and its unique, robust features. An example could be its new components system that takes another leap forward in aligning design with code. Let's dive into how it empowers both designers and developers to create more maintainable and scalable design systems.
articles.title: Build Design Systems With Penpot Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yinjian Huang)
articles.description: This in-depth guide takes you through the three crucial phases of conversational search, revealing how users express their needs, explore results, and refine their queries. Learn how AI agents can overcome communication barriers, personalize the search experience, and adapt to evolving user intent.
articles.title: How To Design Effective Conversational AI Experiences: A Comprehensive Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anna Rátkai)
articles.description: Today, UX design contributes to the problem of excessive consumption through persuasive e-commerce practices and designing for companies with linear and exploitative business models. Anna Rátkai explores practical steps we can take to reduce material consumption and the massive environmental impact that comes along with it by designing mindful shopping experiences.
articles.title: When Friction Is A Good Thing: Designing Sustainable E-Commerce Experiences

articles.title: Useful Customer Journey Maps (+ Figma & Miro Templates)

articles.title: Go for Absolute Beginners

articles.author: Ilknur Eren
articles.description: JAWS (Job Access With Speech) is a screen reader for the Windows operating system. JAWS assists individuals with visual impairments in interacting with computers by helping them navigate applications, read documents, and browse the web. According to WebAIM [https://webaim.org/projects/screenreadersurvey9/#primary], JAWS is the most popular screen reader on the market as
articles.title: How to Use JAWS on Windows

articles.author: Kunal Nalawade
articles.description: Hi fellow developers! Have you ever wondered how social media apps like Facebook and Instagram keep you scrolling endlessly through your feed? articles.title: How to Create Infinite Scrolling in React Using the Intersection Observer API
